title: Developing a Singlish Neural Language Model using ELECTRA
abstract: We develop and benchmark a Singlish pretrained neural language model. To this end, we build a novel 3 GB Singlish freetext dataset collected through various Singaporean websites. Then, we leverage ELECTRA (Efficiently Learning an Encoder that Classifies Token Replacements Accurately) to train a transformer-based Singlish language model. ELECTRA is chosen due to its resource-efficiency to better ensure reproducibility. We further build two text classification datasets in Singlish: sentiment analysis and language identification. We use the two datasets to fine-tune our ELECTRA model and benchmark the results against other available pretrained models in English and Singlish. Our experiments show that our Singlish ELECTRA model is competitive against the best open-source models we found despite being pretrained within a significantly less amount of time. We publicly release the benchmarking dataset.
venue: International Conference on Advanced Computer Science and Information System

tldr.text: This work builds a novel 3 GB Singlish freetext dataset and leverage ELECTRA (Efficiently Learning an Encoder that Classifies Token Replacements Accurately) to train a transformer-based Singlish language model, which is competitive against the best open-source models.
